intro: Calathea leopardina var. concinna, commonly known as the leopard plant, is a tropical foliage plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, mottled leaves with a leopard-like pattern of dark green and silver markings. The plant belongs to the Marantaceae family and is prized for its ornamental value in both indoor and outdoor gardens. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance, it is often used as a statement plant in modern interior design.
